Repeal of "fishery agreement" called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repeal of "fishery agreement" called for in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Members of over 20 civil organizations including the Tok islet fellowship society and the institute for national studies in South Korea held a people's rally in Seoul on Monday, demanding the nullification of the humiliating South Korea-Japan "fishery agreement" and urged the repeal of the "agreement" and the renegotiation, according to CBS from Seoul.
 Saying that the "agreement" is an unequal agreement which gives up the sovereignty over Tok islet, the participants urged the authorities to immediately repeal the "agreement" and set out on the work of fixing new economic water zone as the validity of the agreement expires on Jan. 22.

Greetings to Indian prime minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Indian prime minister
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, premier of the DPRK cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Indian prime minster Atal Bihari Vajpayee on the occasion of the Day of the Republic of India.
 The message sincerely wished the prime minister and people of India a greater success in their work for the independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Australian general governor
articles.content:
Greetings to Australian general governor
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Peter Hollingworth, general governor of Australia, on its independence day.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would further develop in the future, it sincerely wished him a greater success in his work.

articles.title: Greetings to Indian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Indian President
    Pyongyang, January 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly  of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to K. R. Narayanan, President of India, on the occasion of its day of the republic.
 Expressing belief that the traditional friendly relations between the two countries would further develop in the interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his work and the friendly Indian people progress and prosperity.
